p: Adults exposed to linalool at LD 50 value exhibited inhibition of GST, but it was on par with control. However, LD 50 values of EO and methyl chavicol caused induction of GST levels with EO having a higher ER (4.61) than methyl chavicol (3.09) (F 6,14 = 224.49 P < .005). Topical application of EO, methyl chavicol and linalool induced the enzymes Car E in adults. In the case of Car E levels in adults, those exposed to methyl chavicol at LD 50 had Car E levels at par with control samples. Linalool had higher level of induction of Car E in adults than O. basilicum EO (F 6,14 = 224.49 P < .005).
